program main

   implicit none

   integer :: n, m, x, y, z, i, cnt, N, current, count, next_num_val

   integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: par, rank

   ! First part: process the first Java program's logic

   read(*,*) n, m

   allocate(par(0:n-1), rank(0:n-1))

   do i =0, n-1

      par(i) = i

      rank(i) =0

   end do

   do i =1, m

      read(*,*) x, y, z

      x = x -1

      y = y -1

      call unite(x, y, par, rank)

   end do

   cnt =0

   do i =0, n-1

      if (par(i) ==i) cnt = cnt +1

   end do

   N = cnt

   ! Second part: process the second Java program's logic

   count =0

   current =357

   do while (current <= N)

      if (contains_all(current)) then

         count = count +1

      end if

      current = next_num(current)

   end do

   print*, count

contains

   ! Function to check if a number contains 3,5,7

   logical function contains_all(num)

      integer, intent(in) :: num

      character(len=20) :: s

      logical :: has3, has5, has7

      write(s, '(i0)') num

      s = adjustl(s)

      has3 = .false.

      has5 = .false.

      has7 = .false.

      do i =1, len_trim(s)

         c = s(i:i)

         if (c == '3') has3 = .true.

         if (c == '5') has5 = .true.

         if (c == '7') has7 = .true.

      end do

      contains_all = has3 .and. has5 .and. has7

   end function contains_all

   ! Function to compute next_num

   integer function next_num(current)

      integer, intent(in) :: current

      character(len=20) :: s, new_s, reversed_s

      integer :: len_s, new_length, i, pos

      logical :: f

      write(s, '(i0)') current

      s = adjustl(s)

      len_s = len_trim(s)

      new_s = ' '

      f = .false.

      do i =1, len_s

         pos = len_s -i +1

         current_char = s(pos:pos)

         if (.not. f) then

            if (current_char == '3') then

               new_s(i:i) = '5'

               f = .true.

            else if (current_char == '5') then

               new_s(i:i) = '7'

               f = .true.

            else

               new_s(i:i) = '3'

            end if

         else

            new_s(i:i) = current_char

         end if

      end do

      if (.not. f) then

         new_s(len_s+1:len_s+1) = '3'

         new_length = len_s +1

      else

         new_length = len_s

      end if

      reversed_s = ''

      do i = new_length, 1, -1

         reversed_s = trim(reversed_s) // new_s(i:i)

      end do

      read(reversed_s, *, iostat=ios) next_num

      if (ios /=0) then

         next_num = huge(0)  ! or some error handling, but assuming valid input

      end if

   end function next_num

   ! Union-Find functions

   subroutine unite(x, y, par, rank)

      integer, intent(inout) :: par(:), rank(:)

      integer, intent(in) :: x, y

      integer :: root_x, root_y

      root_x = find(x, par)

      root_y = find(y, par)

      if (root_x == root_y) return

      if (rank(root_x) < rank(root_y)) then

         par(root_x) = root_y

      else

         par(root_y) = root_x

         if (rank(root_x) == rank(root_y)) then

            rank(root_x) = rank(root_x) +1

         end if

      end if

   end subroutine unite

   integer function find(x, par)

      integer, intent(inout) :: par(:)

      integer, intent(in) :: x

      if (par(x) /=x) then

         par(x) = find(par(x), par)

      end if

      find = par(x)

   end function find
